node.text:
Ice cores contain clues about Earth’s ancient past, like frozen viruses and insects. 

The clock is ticking. Read why we can't wait any longer by tapping the link in our bio #ice #glaciers #environment #conservation #sustainability #SDIS21

node.title: Scientists are racing to collect ice cores before global warming melts them

node.accessibility_caption:
A string quartet plays from the 'Violin of Noah', in Venice, Italy. 

Artist Livio De Marchi and Consorzio Venezia Sviluppo built the vessel during the Italian coronavirus lockdown and have dedicated it, and their performance, to those who died from the disease. 

#music #COVID19 #coronavirus #boat #venice 

REUTERS/Manuel Silvestri

node.text:
A string quartet plays from the 'Violin of Noah', in Venice, Italy. 

Artist Livio De Marchi and Consorzio Venezia Sviluppo built the vessel during the Italian coronavirus lockdown and have dedicated it, and their performance, to those who died from the disease. 

#music #COVID19 #coronavirus #boat #venice 

REUTERS/Manuel Silvestri

It will be able to power 6,100 homes. 

Tap the link in our bio to read more. #switzerland #solarpower #sustainability #SDIS21

node.accessibility_caption:
Diego Guerrero, a young boy from Sotomo, Chile, watches a video on his phone. 

Sotomo is one of two places in Chile to be chosen for a pilot project to receive free internet for a year. The signal is received via a satellite dish, which transmits through a wi-fi device. It only works from noon to midnight, because of a constrained supply of diesel to the generator that supplies power to the town. 

#chile #internet #wifi #technology #innovation 

REUTERS/Pablo Sanhueza

node.accessibility_caption:
The audience inside the Richard Rogers theatre in Manhattan, New York, applaud the performance of the musical Hamilton as Broadway shows roar back to life. 

After being closed for more than a year due to the pandemic, the world's most famous live theatre locations are once again open to the public to enjoy renowned shows such as The Lion King, Phantom of the Opera, Chicago and Wicked. 

#musical #theater #arts #broadway #newyork 

REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz

node.text:
The audience inside the Richard Rogers theatre in Manhattan, New York, applaud the performance of the musical Hamilton as Broadway shows roar back to life. 

After being closed for more than a year due to the pandemic, the world's most famous live theatre locations are once again open to the public to enjoy renowned shows such as The Lion King, Phantom of the Opera, Chicago and Wicked. 

#musical #theater #arts #broadway #newyork 

REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz
